name: NPR
text: Fireworks display companies are struggling to make ends meet during what's usually their peak season. One company says business is down 90% this year — estimating a $3 million loss so far. https://t.co/h7IH2ZxrCY

name: NPR
text: Three Aurora, Colo. police officers -- including Jason Rosenblatt, who used a chokehold on Elijah McClain last summer before he had a fatal heart attack -- were fired today following an investigation into photos taken near McClain's memorial. https://t.co/q94WL3IqVX

name: NPR
text:
Silvia Moreno-Garcia's latest is true Gothic horror — set in 1950s Mexico in an isolated house where a young bride believes her new husband is poisoning her and "fleshless things" are troubling her.

A warning from our critic: Don't read it before bed. https://t.co/4SX8LaOuQW

name: NPR
text: Chicago has issued a quarantine order for travelers from states with surging coronavirus cases. As of Monday, people coming to the city from 15 states in the South and West will be asked to quarantine for two weeks or face up to $7,000 in fines. @WBEZ https://t.co/UhIMZvm8zp

name: NPR
text:
Major League Baseball has canceled this year's All-Star game.The only other time the 87-year-old game has been called off was in 1945, when wartime travel restrictions interfered. 

Los Angeles, which was set to host the game, will get it in 2022. 

https://t.co/qdNhNI4xYe

name: NPR
text: Francesca Montanaro is at her dad’s New York pizza shop a few days a week, constructing pizza boxes, learning the register and scooping Italian ice. "Sometimes I feel bored, mostly because there's nothing really to do there for an 11-year-old like me." https://t.co/TqRyhqhB4U

name: NPR
text: Across the U.S., rural "critical access" hospitals were already closing at an alarming rate before the pandemic. Twelve have shuttered since the start of this year alone. https://t.co/2ZtzuAPneG
